<Text: Essays in London and Elsewhere is a book of literary criticism by Henry James published in 1893.>
Triplets:<Henry James
1:
Text: Essays in London and Elsewhere:  The book collected essays that James had written over the preceding several years on a wide range of writers including James Russell Lowell, Gustave Flaubert, Robert Browning and Henrik Ibsen.

Triplets:
<James
2:
--------------------
Text: Essays in London and Elsewhere:  The book also included an interesting general essay on the role of the critic in literature and a piece of travel writing about London.
